intro: Eutriana gracilis, commonly known as the slender eutriana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Eutriana gracilis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
